name: photovoltaic plant construction, 570kWp, multi-Si, on open ground | photovoltaic plant, 570kWp, multi-Si, on open ground | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/27/documentation

This dataset represents the installation of a photovoltaic power plant with a capacity of 570 kWp and a life time of 30 years installed in 2008 on an average location on the world. The plant consists out of the following infrastructure parts (represented by unit processes in the database):  ;- Technology: multi-Si (mc-Si) panel ;- open ground mounting structure  ;-  500 kW inverter ;- 570kWp electric installation;;Source of the image: Edisun Power Europe Ltd. 2012. Our facilities. Spain. Solarpark El Tesoro, 568.9 kWp. Alcolea del Rio (Andalusia) 2008. http://www.edisunpower.com/en/home-en/about_edisun_power/our-facilities/spain/solarpark-el-tesoro-en (accessed 23.01.2012)

This dataset starts from the purchase of the needed components for the photovoltaic open ground power plant. 

This activity ends with the installation of the power plant.

This dataset includes all components for the installation of a 570 kWp open ground photovoltaic plant (modules, mounting system, electric installation, inverter, fence) and the energy use for mounting.

This dataset doesn't include any end of life treatment as this is included in the underlying datasets. This dataset doesn't include any land use as this is already considered in the mounting system dataset.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/422:Construction of utility projects/4220:Construction of utility projects

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This dataset is based on a photovoltaic open ground power plant in Spain.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Current technology for mounting of panels or laminates, electric installations and other components.;;Technical data of the 570 kWp PV plant this dataset is based on:;-Source: Questionnaire filled by Edisun Power AG, Spain;-Mounting system: open ground;-annual electricity produced: 847.5 MWh;-Area of installed modules (m2):4273.5;-No lightning protection;- Fuse box weight: not known; - Cabling PV area (m): 5170;- Cabling panels to inverter (m): 1200;-Cabling in-verter to elec-tric meter (m): not known;;The construction process for an open ground power plant is the following: First, the area is measured with a laser, potential test piling is carried out and the foundation profiles are positioned. Then the foundation profiles are piled or screwed into the ground and the heights are levelled. Finally, the rest of the system is mounted and the panels are fixed.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This dataset is based on a photovoltaic open ground power plant in Spain.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Partly confidential data of a questionnaire filled in by the operator of a 570 kWp power plant in Spain (Edisun Power AG). There were commented two 570 kWp photovoltaic power plants by Edisun Power AG with nearly identical properties and performance. One of them was chosen as reference plant.

exchanges.description:
Calculated value. The lifetime of the inverter is assumed with 15 years. Thus, it must be exchanged once during the lifetime of the plant. The amount of inverter materials is approximated with a 500 kW inverter with adjusted inverter weights.
EcoSpold01Location=RER
